captions.text:
It's one of a kind,
and the engine sounds great.
It's just a wonderful feeling.

My boat has the most important parts
from the most outstanding BMW ever.
The BMW 507.
A good friend of mine told me

that there was supposedly a BMW boat
powered by a BMW 507 engine.
Then I started searching to find that boat.

Of course, it was unrestored.
It was badly damaged.
It had been kept in a barn for years and years.

It was intact, all the parts were there,
but we had to completely restore it.
Then I found an expert in southern Germany
who restores Rivas.

And he helped me
completely restore the outer hull

and paint the boat
in the original colours.

I had a professional upholsterer do the interior
just as it was back when it originally came out.

We had an expert
restore the entire instrument panel as well.
No question, it's absolutely unique.
Rambeck is the oldest wharf in Bavaria.
HISTORICAL ACCOUNT

In the 1950s, after the war,
we said, "Let's build a little speedboat."

And there was this big company in Munich
that still exists now, BMW.

They said, "Hey, a boat like that
with our engine, now that would be something."
I was still in school back then.

At the beginning
I didn't really pick up on what was going on,

that it was going to be a hi-tech boat
with the same engine as the ultimate car.
Then we received the emblems.
From the BMW 507, the flat kidney grille.
That in itself was poetry to behold,

and the fact that we at Rambeck got that
was sensational.
And then the steering wheel and the engine.

It was class all around.
That speedboat was the BMW boat.
It had to be one of a kind.

But it had been a very, very long time
since we heard anything about that boat.

And then this guy contacts us,
a total madman.

It's the only way to put it.
Who does that to themselves?

I mean, who goes out and restores a boat
that's a complete wreck?
I'm really glad that ship docks here,
that it is driven here in these waters
where it can be showcased

for people to see
what BMW and Rambeck achieved.

I really like driving cars,
classic cars and convertibles.
But cruising around in that boat
with its BMW engine, that really fascinates me.
I would be happy if someday

I managed to find a BMW 507
Roadster to complement my boat.

Of course, that's not easy,
because they are very rare.
But maybe I'll manage.
I'm Felipe Garcia, and that's my story.

title: The only BMW 507 boat appeared again.
